Every device has a point of failure. What does that mean? Well
Description: a new device fresh from the manufacturer is healthy and problem-free.¬†Due to wear and tear on the device as it ages
Thumbnail url: its health slowly deteriorates and eventually it fails.

Title: At this point
Description: you need to perform maintenance for the device to get it back to a healthy condition. There are three main types of maintenance: Reactive

Title: 1) With reactive maintenance
Description: you simply wait until a device breaks down and then perform maintenance on that device.

Title: That means that you wait until the device fails and requires maintenance and then react
For example
Description: let‚Äôs say that you have a microwave oven at home. You use it for a few years until it gets to the point of failure and It won‚Äôt turn on anymore.

Title: In this case
Description: you repair the microwave or buy a new one. But it may take a couple of days for you to either repair the microwave or buy a new one.

Title: That means
Description: with this wait and react way of maintenance
Thumbnail url: you may not be able to use your microwave for a couple of days which is not a big deal.

Title: However
Description: if the same thing happens in a big industrial enterprise like an oil refinery

Title: 2) With preventive maintenance
Description: you try to perform maintenance for the device long before the device gets to the point of failure.

Title: For example
Description: you can check the pressure transmitter regularly and before it gets to the point of failure to make sure that there won‚Äôt be any sudden interruption to the industrial process.

Title: However
Description: this is not very cost-effective. Because by performing the maintenance early
Thumbnail url: ¬†you waste device life that is still usable.

Title: This is the time that we could still use the device without any maintenance but now we‚Äôre losing that because of early preventing maintenance.
3) With predictive maintenance
Description: you predict when the device fails and schedule maintenance just before that.

Title: Following this process
Description: you minimize the device or machine downtime and maximize its lifetime.

Title: How can we predict when a device fails? Well
Description: this is simply done using the previous data that we have collected from a similar device in the past.

Channel name: we can pretty accurately predict when a similar device fails.

But

Title: One of these intelligent or smart decisions that we can make is to predict when a similar new device will fail in the future and perform maintenance right before that
